sentence.Network_en: The Silkworm Goddess had been beneficent to the tiny village this year.

sentence.Network_en: She had now a life filled also with a beneficent activity.

sentence.Network_en: He was beneficent to the poor.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin beneficent- (stem of beneficentior, comparative of beneficus 'favourable, generous'), from bene facere 'do good (to')

entry.def: A beneficent person or thing helps people or results in something good.

example.ex: ...optimism about the beneficent effects of new technology.
example.tran: 对新技术会带来有益成效的乐观态度

means.word_mean: 3. generous in assistance to the poor;
